page.title: 10KING'S NYMPTON SCHOOL GAMES
page.content: In the 1980's children play a variety of games depending on the age of the children, the available space and the weather. Indoor games may be board games like{Draughts, Snakes and {Ladders}and{Monopoly,}or card games like{Snap, Happy Families}and{Rummy}or electronic games like{Pacman, Scramble and{Frogger.}Outdoor games are more energetic because there is more space. they may be ball games, running games or skipping. Ball games may be played with teams, for example{Netball}and {Football.}Other ball games like {Piggy-the-Middle}and{Catch}can be played in small groups. Running games can often involve chasing and catching. The most popular running game at {King's Nympton School}Junior Class is {Last-one-to-side-is-it. Skipping tends to be played more by girls than boys.
